metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the win-def:sid_sid_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the win-def:sid_sid_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that a sid_sid_object with a trustee_sid is supported.
Test that a sid_sid_object with a trustee_sid pattern match is supported.
Test that a sid_sid_object with a trustee_sid not equals is supported.
Test that the include_group behavior is supported.
Test that the resolve_group behavior is supported.

sid_sid_test.comment: Test that a sid_sid_object with a trustee_sid is supported.
Test that a sid_sid_object with a trustee_sid pattern match is supported.
Test that a sid_sid_object with a trustee_sid not equals is supported.
Test that the include_group behavior is supported.
Test that the resolve_group behavior is supported.

sid_sid_object.comment: Retrieves a sid_sid_object with trustee_sid that equals 'S-1-5-32-544' (the Administrators group).
Retrieves a sid_sid_object with trustee_sid that matches the regular expression '^.*'.
Retrieves a sid_sid_object with trustee_sid that is not equal to 'S-1-5-32-544'.
Retrieves a sid_sid_object with trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544' and with include_group behavior set to false and resolve_group behavior set to true.
Retrieves a sid_sid_object with trustee_sid equals 'S-1-5-32-544' and with resolve_group behavior set to false.

sid_sid_state.comment: This represents a sid_sid_state which has a trustee_sid that equals 'S-1-5-32-544'.
This represents a sid_sid_state which matches the regular expression '^.*.
This represents a sid_sid_state which has a trustee_sid that is not equal to 'S-1-5-32-544'.
This represents a sid_sid_state which has a trustee_sid that is not equal to 'S-1-5-32-544'.
This represents a sid_sid_state which has a trustee_sid that equals 'S-1-5-32-544'.
